name: supermatcher
title: supermatcher
description: <text lang="en">Calculate approximate local pair-wise alignments of larger sequences</text> </description>

format.python: ("", " -datafile=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_datafile.comment: <text lang="en">This is the scoring matrix file used when comparing sequences. By default it is the file 'EBLOSUM62' (for proteins) or the file 'EDNAFULL' (for nucleic sequences). These files are found in the 'data' directory of the EMBOSS installation.</text> </comment>

e_minscore.prompt: Minimum alignment score (value greater than or equal to 0)

format.python: ("", " -minscore=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_minscore.comment: <text lang="en">Minimum alignment score to report an alignment.</text> </comment>

e_width.prompt: Alignment width (value greater than or equal to 1)

format.python: ("", " -width=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_wordlen.prompt: Word length for initial matching (value greater than or equal to 3)

format.python: ("", " -wordlen=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_outfile.prompt: Name of the output alignment file

format.python: ("", " -aformat=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_errorfile.comment: <text lang="en">Error file to be written to</text> </comment>

comment: <text lang="en">smile is a program that was primarily made to extract promoter sequences from sequences. The interest of this program is to infer simultaneously several motifs (calledboxes) that respects distance constraints. The user has to select criterias. In a first step of extraction, all signals respecting these criterias are found. In a second step, they are all statistically evaluated, aiming to detect the ones that are exceptionally represented in the original sequences.</text> </comment>
